page.title: 06TRANSPORT
page.content: GOUROCK PIER_A WELL KNOWN LANDMARK IN THE TOWN OF GOUROCK_WAS BUILT IN 1898.ALTHOUGH IT IS MUCH LESS BUSY THAN IN THE PAST,FERRY SERVICES STILL USE THE PIER.THE FERRIES JUNO AND JUPITER REGULARLY CROSS THE CLYDE TO ROTHESAY,DUNOON AND KILCREGGAN.OWNED BY THE CALEDONIAN_MACBRAYNE COMPANY THESE FERRIES_BUILT IN 1974_CAN CARRY 700 PASSENGERS AND 40 CARS.THEY TRAVEL AT A MAXIMUM SPEED OF 14 KNOTS. A RAILWAY LINE FROM GLASGOW RUNS ONTO THE PIER AND INTO A LARGE STATION.MOST OF THE TRAINS ON THIS LINE WERE BUILT AT THE SPRINGBURN WORKS IN GLASGOW.THEY ARE NOW MOSTLY PAINTED IN THE DISTINCTIVE BLACK AND ORANGE COLOURS OF STRATHCLYDE TRANSPORT. THE GOUROCK AREA IS ALSO WELL SERVED BY LOCAL BUS SERVICES.
